text:
Naruto Spin Offs Fans Want to See Riley Hutchins Start Slideshow Slide of 
Naruto, the infamous loveable ninja in the orange jumpsuit, is one of the most popular characters in anime history. The franchise has been around since 1997 and continues to be relevant today. Both the original anime series Naruto, and the the ongoing sequel to the original Naruto Shippuden, are two of the most watched animes in Japan. With Shippuden set to finally come to a close in 2017, fans are already asking for more. 
The creator of Naruto, Masashi Kishimoto, already announced a new anime series set for release in spring of 2017, based off of the Boruto manga. Boruto is a spin off of the original manga, and follows the son of Naruto and Hinata. Fans quickly fell in love with Boruto and are excited for the art to come to life with the anime spin off. 
Kishimoto isnâ€™t done with Naruto and said there are many anime spin off possibilities. This could mean seeing more about the history behind the original series, learning more about other ninja villages, or brand new characters and adventures. This got us thinking about what some Naruto spin off ideas that we want to see. 
So here are 5 Naruto spin offs fans want to see:
